properties.name: @ The Loft w/ Making April and Foreverinmotion
properties.description: Posted by JcbhurstMadison, Wisconsin April, 18 2007 at @ The Loft w/ Making April and Foreverinmotion 827 E. Washington Ave., Madison, Wisconsin 53701 Cost : Website: thejourneymusic.com myspace: myspace.com/journeymusic Ticket outlet: thejourneymusic.indietickets.com

properties.name: A Nice Rest in Portland
properties.description: Posted by Lolly    635 NE Going St Portland, ORIt\'s great hanging out with good friends for a bunch of days in a row. I think Erik is enjoying sleeping in a bed. Jason and Di-Ann happen to have the most comfy bed I\'ve ever slept on in their guest room.

properties.name: A Nice Stop in Millerton
properties.description: Posted by Testytester Millerton, NYOn the morning of the second day, we stopped in Millerton, NY, one of [some travel magazine]’s top ten hip small towns perfect for a stop on a road trip. We found out that it had been awarded this distinction from a copy of the magazine that was displayed at the flower shop where they sold chairs and tables carved out of single tree trunks. It was a pleasant stop.

properties.name: A Night with Steve & Naomi
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing Ashville, NCI’ve been driving barefoot a lot, and Asheville certainly is a barefoot kind of place. Steve and Naomi are old friends of Judy and Dave, parents of Shane who was in Vigo’s first grade class last year. They made us feel comfortable right away, even though they were probably going through their toughest time in a while. Vigo and their son Sam became good pals. We stayed two nights. I helped Naomi get ready for her trip to the Northeast by folding some laundry and returning library books. It was harder to find anything I could do to help Steve who was supremely exhausted by a medical treatment he was taking. I hope I get to experience the normal Steve one day. It was a nice relaxing time after the always slightly stressful days touring with my patents. I got to leave Vigo with Naomi for an hour and a half on Monday afternoon so I could ride my bike into town and see what all the fuss was about. Asheville seems like a funky little place indeed. There seem to be several different trends balancing each other out: street people, yuppies, students, hippies, givernment wiriers, with businesses or organizations catering to them all clustered in the small downtown area. Our friends live in West Asheville, which has its own little strip of healthy local businesses. Naomi keeps bees. Steve helped start WPVM, the low-power progressive/freeform FM station owned by the Mountain Area Network community ISP.

properties.name: A Short Stop in Nantmeal Village
properties.description: Posted by Testytester Nantmeal Village PennsylvaniaPennsylvania is beautiful. I would have liked to spend more time in Nantmeal Village.

properties.name: After the Rush
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing After the fun at the Speedway, we camped at Rush along the Buffalo National Wild River. It was great except for a two-hour commotion when cops came questioning people. They never got to us, but I heard them tell this one couple, “We just want to make sure you’re not fugitives from the law”. They ended up arresting a guy who had arrived with his boat in tow shortly after we arrived. There were two fish and game pickups and two county sheriff cruisers. They were seriously harshing my mellow if you know what I mean. The place was called Rush after a zinc rush in the late 1800s early 1900s. There is a ghost town there now

properties.name: American Museum of Science and Energy
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  300 S Tulane Ave, Oak Ridge, TN 37830With the seriousness of atom bombs, we stopped in Oak Ridge after driving through the smokies and resisting the sirens of Pigeon Forge - Dollywood and go karts. Vigo had a lot of fun at the American Museum of Science and Energy, where they had several exhibits about the Manhattan Project. Vigo had a great time there. He was a bit disappointed that we didn’t make it to the actual site of the secret city. I didn’t see it clearly marked, so I’m not even sure that there is anything to see. Pictures are the two sculptures they have outside the museum.

properties.name: Arkansas’s Second Oldest Town
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing 40 General St, Batesville, AROn our way to Yellville we passed through places named Marked Tree, Fifty Six, and Big Flat. I ended up going into the historic center of Batesville, Arkansas’s second oldest town - partly because I got on the wrong road. It was a fortuitous mistake.

properties.name: BBQ, Cigars and Hospitality in Smithville
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing Smithville, TNAfter getting my discount hand rolled Nicaraguan cigar in Smithville, I headed across the street to Sue’s restaurant on advice from Cathy at the tobacco store because they lived right around there and might know about good places to throw up our tent. Sue didn’t but one of her locals pointed us toward a campground right over the bridge, a place that wasnt even on our map. I got a plate of BBQ to go as well since cathy said the food was good. I rolled down all the windows and we backtracked a couple of miles in the sweet evening air - absolutely perfect time for a cigar at the wheel! We got to the campground just in time to enjoy the setting sun on Center Hill Lake. Fine BBQ too!

properties.name: Cafe Montmartre
properties.description: Posted by Jason Madison, Wisconsin April, 13 2007 at Cafe Montmartre 127 East ifflin Street, Madison, Wisconsin 53703 Cost : http://www.themomo.com/

properties.name: Camping Out Along the Farmington River
properties.description: Posted by Testytester This probably isn\'t the exact spot, but it\'s somewhere along this river that they camped

properties.name: Car Trouble!
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing San Juan Capistrano, CAJuly 23rd, 2008. The check engine light started flashing. Erik and Vigo stopped at the Mazda dealership.

properties.name: Chandelier Tree
properties.description: Posted by Lolly      I have dreamed of visiting a drive-through tree since I was a kid. It was pretty much just as cool as I had imagined it would be. On our way out of the park, I let Vigo run alongside the car as I idled in second gear. Then he started jumping onto the trunk and jumping back off again. Finally we let him jump into the moving car\'s open back door. Pretty thrilling, even if the car is only going 3 miles per hour.

properties.name: Children's Museum of Memphis
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing 2525 Central Avenue, Memphis, TN, 38104Ambitious plan for today: the Childrens Museum of Memphis in the morning then a 230 mile drive to get to the NorthCentral Arkansas Speedway to catch a Full Race Program by eight pm. I’m no expert at childrens museums, but Memphis’s seems like it’s pretty decent. Vigo loved it.

properties.name: Comfort Inn
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing 1211 N. Glebe Rd. , Arlington, VAWe got to the District of Columbia around one in the afternoon. Again I chose to drive right through the city. I ended up on New York Ave. Traffic was beastly. It took me an hour to cross the city. Still I enjoyed it. When we were near the white house I woke Vigo up. He had been napping all this time. He barely looked at the place. I tried to get him to look out at the Washington Monument as well but he preferred his sleep. We arrived at the hotel in Arlington a mere twenty minutes before my parents. Our dog Sam would have to stay on the car because they didn’t allow pets. I decided right then not to spend more than one day sightseeing in DC so that Sam wouldn’t be stuck in the car too long. The hotel had an underground garage where it didn’t get too warm. Sam even seemed to enjoy the safety of the car. We humans went to a chain restaurant in the Ballston neighborhood of Arlington. Then we returned to the hotel room. I took Sam for a nice long walk and then practically fell asleep for the night around seven. Vigo engaged in his favorite hotel activity: watching tv, which he doesn’t get to do at home. My parents were as tired as I was and no one was in the mood to hunt down some excitement across the Potomac. We decided to leave that for the next day.

properties.name: DOTR Part 2 with Showbread, Tyler Read- The Majestic Theatre
properties.description: Posted by Mrthux Madison, Wisconsin March, 15 2007 at DOTR Part 2 with Showbread, Tyler Read- The Majestic Theatre Not Available , Madison, Wisconsin Cost :

properties.name: Dabney State Recreation Area
properties.description: Posted by Lolly   We had a great evening picnic with the kids here. Dogs are not allowed, but we didn\'t know that before we arrived. The current is fast and fun here.

properties.name: Durango CO
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing durango coRetiring boomers, healthy mountain folks, and a variety of good-looking young hipsters makes for a cool downtown with three independent coffeshops.

properties.name: Funky Armadillo
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing Amarillo, TXWe drove around Amarillo for an hour. Vigo yelled “Funky Armadillo!” out the window for most of that time. We had BBQ at Dyers. We saw a really funny car next to a biker bar.

properties.name: Got a Call from the Road Today (July 18, 2008)
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing

properties.name: Hanging Out in Nashville
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing We got to Nashville in the driving rain. We found heaven at Starbucks: hot beverages, pastries, and wifi. We spent a couple of hours there. In the meantime the sun had come out and Sam was not in very good shape when we got back to the car. I won’t let that happen again. We drove around the city a lot. We didn’t really have an aim. Grand Ole Opry wasn,t in session. We hung out at an att store for two hours. Finally we had everything we needed and we headed for Broadway downtown where we walked around soaking up the music coming from the 21+ clubs. There was one place where we could both go and enjoy some fried food, jim beam, and live music: the Paradise Park, a trailer themed bar that Vigo had spotted from the moment we set foot on Broadway. “Thats where I want to go” he had said. “I want to walk up and down the street and see what else there is before we decide where to go” I insisted, which hardly made sense to Vigo. The stroll past bar after bar with great live music was pleasant despite the prevalence of “must be 21″ signs.

properties.name: Hanging out for a Day while the Car Gets Fixed
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing Laguna Beach, CAThe car broke down and needs some repair. While it\'s in the shop, Vigo, Erik, and Sam are going to hang out at Laguna Beach. They were hoping to be near Huntington Beach, which seems pretty dog-friendly, but they\'ll make do.

properties.name: Hanging out with Birgit and Sam in the Mission
properties.description: Posted by Lolly This isn\'t the exact location of the house, but this is the neighborhood. We had a great time as usual hanging out. Sam and Erik cooked a couple of nice meals. We went to a beach, we went to the wharf. Erik is in love with San Francisco. This is where he and I got married.

properties.name: Hitting Memphis
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing MemphisDrove around the downtown area a lot. Great riverfront. So many neighborhoods in transition right by the main strip. Also: a few gated communities right in the urban core. We stopped to reflect at the Lorraine Motel where Martin Luther King was shot and talked to Jacqueline Smith, who has been holding a one-woman civil-rights protest across the street for a long time. She gave me a copy of an article about her in German. We stayed on the sixth floor of the downtown Sleep Inn: sweet.

properties.name: Legoland California
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing      One Legoland Drive, Carlsbad, CA, United StatesThis was going to be the highlight of the trip for Vigo

properties.name: Lightning in Tulsa
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing We got to Tulsa OK by mid afternoon. We stopped in a muy shady part of town. Some hard living girls were “getting rides” from truckers. Finally got enough wifi to find the local theater showing Wall-E. Spent a pleasant couple hours. Drove around Tulsa. Finally found a starbucks with help over the phone from Tracy. It was lightning like crazy. We spent 3 hours there. I had decided to drive all night to get past Oklahoma. One of the baristas invited me to taste coffees with him which is part of his training. We tasted Sumatran and Arabian Sanai both from the French press. When the rain got really hard I dashed out to the car to close the windows. Lightning had fallen two blocks away. I knew it was risky. The car was parked under a tree. As I was running towards it. Lightning struck an electricity pole in frontof the coffeshop. I saw the sky get lighter and then even lighter. I was too far away to feel the electrified skin crawling sensation that you’re supposed to feel in those cases but the sound follwed instantaneously and an eight-foot ball of white-yellow fire and sparks erupted around the power lines. It lasted a couple of seconds.

properties.name: Looking for the Natchez Trace Parkway
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing Riding through the tony farm country west of Nashville trying to locate the entrance of the Natchez Trace Parkway, I blew a fuse trying to relight my cigar using the car’s lighter plugged into the adapter accessory that I was using to charge the batteries for the digital camera. I stopped at Leipers Fork to borrow some pliers to extract the fuse. A picturesque little place full of very friendly people.

properties.name: Madison, Wisconsin
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingMadison, Wisconsin

properties.name: Mount Rushmore
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing

properties.name: Nashville
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing Nashville, tn

properties.name: National Mall
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing Not just any afternoon either: it was “America’s Birthday”, in the phrase that I don’t remember hearing with such insistence before–but maybe I wasn’t paying attention before. Everything was crowded, but not overly so. The systems in place were designed to handle throngs: the Metro, the bag check to enter the Mall, the museums. We toured the Air and Space Museum and the Hirschhorn–the latter not without protestations from Vigo who was worried he’d miss the best shows on the hotel tv. At the Hirschhorn, we watched all thirty minutes of Fischli and Weiss’s Der Lauf Der Dinge, which SO beats any afternoon childrens television.

properties.name: Parisian Reunion 2008
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing 24 Oxbow Road, Egremont, MAA lot of old friends are getting together for a weekend here. I\'m really looking forward to it!

properties.name: Pulled Over in Baltimore
properties.description: Posted by Testytester Baltimore, MDWe drove right through Baltimore on US 1. Baltimore is of course a trip and a half. Visions of John Waters movies and the TV show The Wire kept going through my mind as I rambled past blocks of boarded up brick houses and low rise apartment blocks. I was vaguely aware that Vigo was not sitting like an upright citizen in his booster seat. A few blocks north of downtown a cop flashes his lights at me. I pull over. “You know why I’m pulling you over don’t you?” “Uh is it because of how my son isn’t sitting properly?” “Not just that but he had his feet out the window. That can be dangerous especially in a neighborhood like this” added the kind young black officer before letting us go our way. I wish I had more time to explore Baltimore.

properties.name: Pushed on to Port Jervis
properties.description: Posted by Testytester Port Jervis, NYWe pushed through Poughkepsie and on to Port Jervis, where we hung out on the main drag with Mrs. Graf for a while. Port Jervis doesn’t make the list, but maybe some day…

properties.name: Rolling Family Reunion 2008
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    * Theme: Your favorite sport or team * Best display for those camping. Best tailgate party (probably on Friday). * On Saturday, "show your talent" - from capentry to singing, writing, etc. * A tribute to those who have gone before.

properties.name: Smithsonian National Museum of Natural History
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing 10th Street and Constitution Ave., NW, WASHINGTON, DC, 20004Vigo and Erik went to the Smithsonian with Elly and Helmut. I wish I was with them!

properties.name: Starting Point
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing 98 Oxford St Somerville, MAJuly 1st, Erik and Vigo and Sam hit the road.

properties.name: University of Wisconsin-Madison Der Rathskeller
properties.description: Posted by BootchMadison, Wisconsin March, 23 2007 at University of Wisconsin-Madison Der Rathskeller 800 Langdon Street, Madison, Wisconsin 53706 Cost : Freewww.union.wisc.edu/music/programing.html * Der Rathskeller is widely recognized as the best place to see live music in the city of Madison. All shows are free and all ages, and a wide variety of food and alcoholic beverages are offered in facilities throughout the Memorial Union. *

properties.name: We had a nice meal in Florence
properties.description: Posted by Lolly Can\'t remember the exact name of the restuarant. It was a Mexican seafood place, with a deck righton the river. We were running late getting to Portland and stopped here to get some food before giving up on Highway 101 and cutting through Eugene to catch 5.

properties.name: Went to the Rodeo
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  1143 Sheridan Ave Cody, WyomingVigo even went into the rodeo ground to try to snatch ribbons off of the tails of calves to win some free ice cream.
